Fields.DialogueText: Where did I keep those documents?
*Usagi - a huge red-crowned crane - squawks and thrashes about the cabin*
Whoa, Usagi-san!... Ow, my head. Not on the shelf! Usagi-san, please!
Usagi-san?
Fubuki! Usagi-san is throwing down the contents of the bookshelf. Please get her out of here...
Ara ara. Why would you do this Usagi-san? Kochi kochi. Hai, good, Usagi-san.
Why was she even here, Fubuki? The cargo bay is in the opposite direction.
Wakaranai. She doesn't care about paper or other structures all too often.

Fields.MenuText: By any chance is she sick?
Is this a new crane behavior?
Maybe she's hungry?

Fields.DialogueText: I hope not. The on-call doctor down in the lower levels might know, however. He has studied red-crowned cranes for over years.
Usagi-san has never attempted to destroy property on the premise. This is truly strange...
Īe. If she was hungry, she would have immediately roosted in my lap and patiently wait for me to feed her.
This doesn't make any sense then...
Sumimasen, Kanchou. I will try not to inconvenience you with Usagi-san any longer so that she does not damage any more property.
I'm fine with Usagi-san because she is a big part of your life, Fubuki. All I care about is both of you being healthy and happy.
Arigatō, Kanchou. Ah...
*ALARM*
Those Morganas will never let up...
@BATTLE
Kanchou, may I have a word with you after we "cheese" these Funayūrei down to their rat holes?
Sure. What would yo-- Wait... was that a pun?
Hai, Kanchou. I was told various words that can be used for in puns. With a promising result!
Heh.
@BATTLE
Fubuki? There you are. What did you want to talk about?
Ah. Firstly, let me apologize for the pun. These circumstances do not require humor, but I thought to instill the situation with a joke anyway.
No, no, Fubuki. It makes me happy to see you try new things.
Arigatō, Kanchou. Do you know the iconic tree of Japan, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: Oak?
Cherry?
Plum?

Fields.DialogueText: The oak tree? Īe. While the tree is a sight to wonder, that is not our national tree. It is the sakura, the cherry blossom tree.
Hai! You are correct, Kanchou.
Close, Kanchou.  When they bloom, they can be mistaken as a sakura. The answer is the fragile sakura, the cherry blossom tree.
I would like to acquire one tree for my Farm, Kanchou.
Really? Aren't those trees more suitable to be viewed in the spring rather than in the winter?
Yes and no. Sakura trees exhibit qualities of delicateness and fragility in the spring. In winter, they are barren, but they are a symbol of courage to me.
Holding on throughout a winter that may never end, they still live on for hopes of a coming spring.
And you want this tree because it will tie in with the Farm well?
That is correct, Kanchou.
I can say no to some Belles, but you are the one of the most sensible, Fubuki. I'll gladly get you a cherry tree the next time we are in Japan or anywhere else that grows them.
You hear that, Usagi-san? You have a new home!
*Usagi honks happily*
Just remember to keep her away from the bookshelves, Fubuki...
Hai, Kanchou! Arigatō!
Funayūrei! Usagi-san! Get Kanchou immediately!
*Usagi honks urgently*
Hey, stop! Fubuki, I'm already here! I was just coming out of the gall-- Ow, all right, I am sorry I'm late, Usagi-san!
Earthquakes arrive for those who are both prepared and unprepared.
You're right, Fubuki. Wait, if there are multiple Morganas, maybe we can blow on the horagai?
Sou sou. Excellent thinking, Kanchou. I shall--
Um, Fubuki. Can I try it instead?
Oh? Have you blown a horagai before, Kanchou? They can be tricky to play.
If we're going to instill fear in these Morganas, they have to know that their Captain is as fearless as their Belles.
Admirable, Kanchou. Hai. Please show me what you can do.
Here goes...
Kanchou that is not the correct ho-
Prrrrrrrrffffftttt... ... prrfft... .
Ah...

Fields.MenuText: Hey, I tried my best!
That was no good at all, was it?
Sorry. I let you down, Fubuki.

Fields.DialogueText: Ano...
Huh...
Hah...
Augh... Let's get this over with...
Hahaha! Itai, itai! My stomach!... .
Īe! I cannot laugh at Kanchou...
@BATTLE
The winds are freely moving today. Do not dare disturb their pilgrimage, Funayūrei. Beautiful snow may rest upon those winds.
@BATTLE
Amazing! You went all out today, Fubuki. Nice work.
Īe. It was nothing, Kanchou.
Hm?
Sumimasen, Kanchou. My mind is not with me today.

Fields.MenuText: What's wrong?
You can talk to me, Fubuki. You know that, right?
Where has your mind gone, exactly?

Fields.DialogueText: Hah... The wind is icy within my breath too. This does not bode well.
Hai, wakatteru. Arigatō, Kanchou.
Far from here... to Hokkaido... to my family.
Is it about Miyuki?
Hai. I am remembering the memories we shared together in one brief moment on this earth.
What specifically?
Miyuki was more... rebellious than any of our sisters. Proper attire did not suit her and she would always speak her mind without regard of who it is.
She even felt a special connection with one of her crewmembers. Almost romantic, in a way.
Without awakening as a Belle? Bizarre... Miyuki is an entirely entity than you.
Hai. We had one striking difference that made us into a good team. Miyuki cared more about defense, which I find humorous.
As her onee-san, I should be more concerned about that parameter.
It makes you unique, Fubuki.
You think so? Arigatō, Kanchou. I receive compliments regularly from you, but they never tire upon my ears.
Kanchou!
Whoa, Fubuki! What is the matter?
Usagi-san... Usagi-san!
Morganas couldn't pick a worse time than now. Fubuki, take my hand. No, don't collapse. We'll deal with Usagi-san after this skirmish, but I need you to stand.
Sumimasen, Kanchou...
@BATTLE
Usagi-san... .
What happened, Fubuki?
Usagi-san is missing, Kanchou. I have looked all over the destroyer...

Fields.MenuText: Maybe she's in my cabin messing with my bookshelf again?
She can't have gone far, Fubuki. Usagi-san loves you dearly.
Where was the last place you saw her, Fubuki?

Fields.DialogueText: I have checked there, Kanchou. She is nowhere to be found...
Wakatteru. But no one on board has seen her either.
At the Farm. She was pecking the ground where I have planned the sakura tree's location would be.
Fubuki... she will return. Somewhere deep in your soul, you know this to be true.
Calm yourself and meditate, Fubuki. Usagi-san would not want you to stress over her, would she?
You are correct, Kanchou. I am sorry I allowed myself to get emotional once more.
No, I understand. I would be upset, too, if someone I love disappears so suddenly. Come here, Fubuki. There, there.
Captain! Morganas are approaching west in a tight V-formation.
Hm? We have seen that before. Why do you sound panicked, sailor?
The Morgana order of battle, Captain... They look intimidating.
If we avoid this battle--
No.
What?
... Um, I have other duties to attend to. If you will excuse me...
Fubuki, what's wrong?
In this situation, Kanchou, what other options are present?

Fields.MenuText: Avoid the situation altogether, like I said before?
Call for backup?
Use a scapegoat?

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou... I am being serious with you...
A smart choice, but not one we can react to in time.
Who would we use as a scapegoat? A Morgana? Please, Kanchou, be rational.
We cannot avoid battles, Kanchou.
We risk more than we gain if these Funayūrei are allowed to go wherever they please.
Fubuki, I can't risk putting the crew in danger. And what about you? What will I do if you get hurt?
Kanchou, your concern is flattering, but you forget I am the spirit of this destroyer. You need not worry all the time, Kanchou.
Walk beside me along this snowy battlefield and we will prevail.
... I trust you, Fubuki.
@BATTLE
These winds are all lonely today...
*Usagi flaps her wings and squawks*
Huh? Usagi-san?! ... Oh, Buddha! Usagi-san! Kochi kochi, Usagi-san! Hai, I missed you so much. What do you have here in your talons, Usa-san?
Kanchou! Usagi-san is back!
But what is that in her talons? Anyway, we don't have time for that, Fubuki. Morganas appeared out of nowhere. We need you on deck immediately.
Hai! Come with me, Usagi-san, and let them hear the proper cry of our horagai!
*Usagi honks in agreement*
"Proper"? Mine was proper too...
@BATTLE
Is Usagi-san all right?
Īe. She was carrying... this.
Is that a katana?
Hai... and there is a bloody note attached to it. It is written in what appears to be an Enigma code.
WOBD ZKLT KCOB KWHJ VTDK MIEV CQSK PJZY LQZF VRWY RPA.
What does that mean?

Fields.MenuText: Fubuki, please tell me.
Fubuki, we are in this together. Don't leave me out of this.
What's wrong?

Fields.DialogueText: Hai.
Sumimasen, Kanchou. My intention was not to hurt you over this.
It is just that...
The message was a script in blood. Threatening and vile. It had coordinates... We need to go towards them, Kanchou.
I think I missed something here. You want to follow a death threat?
Hai. No other Funayūrei has communicated on a level such as this. Miyuki must be the one who sent this message, Kanchou. Why she did, I do not know. But we must find out.
Very well. But, please, Fubuki. Promise me you will not throw away your life to save her.
Hai.
Funayūrei... They never learn to stop in these cold waters.
To be fair, they wouldn't have stopped in hot waters either.
Was that a joke?
Um...
Heh, daijoubou. I was purely jesting.
@BATTLE
Sugoi!
*Usagi honks mischievously*
Hey Fubuki, do we have-- Whoa! Aaaah! Ow...
Ara ara. Are you ok, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: No...
Yeah... I narrowly escaped death there.
I-I-I think something is broken... Tail... bone...

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, a scratch on the cheek is not a fatal blow, Kanchou.
Thank the Buddha you did not land on your head.
Kanchou, you landed on your arm, not on your tailbone. I believe you are going to live.
Anyway, Usagi-san brought lots of snow for us!
Wait, is that all right to keep it here?
Hai. The crew has been lenient to keep the temperatures just under freezing to allow us an appreciation of snow. Kanchou... Do you know how much joy this brings?
I get to feel the snow. Wet when touched, yet comforting throughout all the senses.
I think that is because it's numbing you down... Don't catch a cold, Fubuki.
Oh... Oh no...  Īe...  Īe,  Īe...
Fubuki?
@BATTLE
Kanchou... mite kudasai.
That's...
One of Usagi-san's feathers... and it is bloodied. Naze...

Fields.MenuText: We can't assume the worst.
Fubuki... it's probably not what you think.
Do you think she was injured by someone on the ship?

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou... What will I do?
Then why does one of her tender feathers possess markings of blood?
Īe. No one on this ship had a problem with Usagi-san. Who would think about harming an innocent crane?
Fubuki, remain calm. We will find her. She received that katana from your sister. If that came from Miyuki, we have a good chance of finding Usagi-san in that same location.
Kanchou...
Right. The deck is free now. Why don't you take a break and rearrange the wooden pallets in a wabi-sabi manner, Fubuki?
Hai.
Fubuki...
*ALARM*
Usagi-san would take pleasure in seeing you run. It is not the same without her...
She did?
Hai. She would also say "skree!" with joy whenever we struck a Funayūrei.
Wonder why I haven't noticed that before?
@BATTLE
Fubuki, can you come down with me to the Farm?
Hai. What is this concerning?
You will have to see! Here we are... Look at that!
Sakura...
You don't enjoy it?
Īe. I do, Kanchou. Arigatō...

Fields.MenuText: Is it about Miyuki?
Is it about Usagi-san?
Do you not like cherry blossom trees any longer?

Fields.DialogueText: It is also about Usagi-san, Kanchou.
It is also about Miyuki, Kanchou.
Kanchou, I said I enjoyed it. Please believe me. I appreciate your sentiment and care, Kanchou. It is like a gentle touch of a snowflake upon the skin.
Watashi... I... do not know what Miyuki is thinking of, Kanchou. Or what Usagi-san has to do with this situation.
We will find out, Fubuki. Every day, we're drawing closer and closer to her coordinates. We'll bring Usagi-san back home. I promise.
Tai-CHO!
Whoa, hey! Oof! I got you. Are you all right?
Ah... Hai... That was so sudden. I felt as if a river took me under its current, and I had no control.
Oh, I apologize, Fubuki. I asked the crew to try a new wax on the deck. The old wax was getting grubby and was sticking to the crew's boots.
But if they started the waxing duties in the morning, why does it still stick under our feet?
Hm... They're still using the old wax aren't they?
Ahem. Thank you for rescuing me in time, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Did you sprain anything?
No problem, Fubuki.
It was my pleasure, Fubuki.

Fields.DialogueText: I do not believe so. But in war, you never show weakness to the enemy, Kanchou.
But... please tell the crew to use the new wax this time, Kanchou.
Was it, Kanchou? Ara ara. Flattering me with your care as always.
The sirens... Can you walk?
I appreciate the concern, truly, but I am not out of commission. A spirit of the destroyer does not fall easily.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
The horizon... bare. Dou shiyou... Ah!
Fubuki, the sides of the ship are-
Kanchou! Stop the ship! Immediately!
Fubuki? We can't stop right here. We've got Morganas!
@BATTLE
Kanchou... Kore...
A dripping wet skeleton?! Did you really just order the ship to stop here to bring THAT aboard?
Tohru-san.
Miyuki's... special crewmember?
Hai, mite kudasai. This is not madness. Somehow because of my connection to Miykui... I just knew his remains were here. And look! This bracelet on his wrist confirms it.
Why would his remains be here, and not at the location of where Miyuki sank?
Exactly, Kanchou... Think about it.

Fields.MenuText: What do you want to with Tohru?
We can't leave Tohru on board, Fubuki.
And yet we're still trying to go after Miyuki?

Fields.DialogueText: We commit his body to the waves, but with a proper burial at sea.
Wakatteru. It is not easy to see someone you knew dearly from your past...
Hai. That will not change, Kanchou.
I will make preparations, Kanchou. And yes, I will do this swiftly. I know we cannot linger here.
Right. Once you're ready, I'll be there for the service.
Come closer, Funayūrei! Your demise awaits!
@BATTLE
Fubuki, there you are! Hm. Still feeling a bit rough?
Hai, Kanchou. A bit.
Why don't we go to the Farm for a brief respite away from the crew, shall we?
I would like that, Captain.
Here you are.
Cherry tea?
The tea is not authentically cherry blossom tea, but, I thought you could at least drink something while you sit next to your tree. Might be nice, right?
It would be, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not doing a good job cheering you up, am I?
Are you going to taste it?
How about we try it together?

Fields.DialogueText: Sumimasen, Kanchou. You are doing fine. I am the one who refuses to smile. Please, let us taste this wonderful tea together.
Hai. The earth would have wasted her efforts on such a gift.
That would be nice, Kanchou. Please, do the honors.
All right! I will get the water boiling and here! A hizakake to keep you warm, Fubuki. I know Miyuki had her own, but you deserve one too.
I do not know what to say, Kanchou. You are making my heart feel quite warm. Arigatō.
Funayūrei are-- Fubuki?
Kanchou, look! That group of Morganas was closing our position, but they suddenly changed course...
What is happening?
Peculiar. The Funayūrei did not fight... They fled. Now let me plot this... There. Look at this azimuth. Funayūrei were fleeing from the direction Miyuki established... here.

Fields.MenuText: What do you want to do? Do you still want to head in her direction?
We can still head back, Fubuki.
I... am not sure if we should still do this...

Fields.DialogueText: Hai. We will not give in to her threats. Lives may be in danger thanks to her. We will continue forward.
Cowering from my own family will succumb me to the dirt. I will not run from Miyuki, no matter what she is now or will be.
We are not fleeing when we are this close to Miyuki, Kanchou. We will not dispute this decision again.
I understand. Do you still promise me that you will not lose your life to her if this is Miyuki?
Fubuki!
I am sorry, Kanchou. I will meditate on this.
Another group, further off. We have to engage them, Fubuki.
Hai, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
Kanchou... These coordinates are near.
Stay on high alert and protect us at all costs. Do I make myself clear?
Protect me? But, Kanchou--
Fubuki, I will become dead inside if I see you get harmed. It will not happen today, no matter how much you seem to wish it so.
Kanchou...
Where is she? Miyuki!
*radio crackles with an evil voice: "The water is blood. Blood from youth. Youth from children. Children know nothing. Nothing. Nothing. Nothing. NOT-thing."*
Mi-Miyuki? Is that you?
*radio crackles again: Oh, but I have a special surprise for you... Do you want my blood, Funayūrei? My precious, cold blood? Well, fat chance! BANG!"*
Miyuki! Miyuki-chan! Listen to me! Stop this! You know better! Chotto matte kudasai!
Fubuki?
We've detected a passenger ship out there, Kanchou. Miyuki is going to sink them, Kanchou. Stop her!

Fields.MenuText: Fubuki, you would yell at me if I hurt her. What would you have me do exactly?
I can't ask her to stop, Fubuki.
It's not that simple, Fubuki. Think of the passengers that will die if I initiate a battle here.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou...
Yes, you can, Kanchou. Please, you must try something before they all die!
They will die either way with or without your interference!
*radio growls: "BANG! Too late. Can't even decide what to have for dinner without a constant squabbles. Couples, sheesh."*
*another voice on the radio: (garbled) ship, we (garbled) ... we are unarmed ... do not (garbled) ... HELP!"*
Miyuki-chan, you cannot...
*radio: Oh, I can my love. Toodles. Skreeeee!"*
Morganas are coming at us from all directions. Fubuki, we attack and then leave. We cannot possibly take them all at once!
Where... where did she learn to say "Toodles" and "Skreeee"?
@BATTLE
Kanchou, we must return to Miyuki.
Wait, why? We barely fought our way out of there, and--
We did not take notice last time, but I heard Usagi-san's cry just before we left Miyuki. It cannot be a coincidence.
I understand. We need to get that ball of feathers back. Those holes in my head won't be pecked by themselves.
*Some Time Later*
Hm, it was supposed to be around here...
We're right on top of--
*cruel voice on the radio: "Hello, there. Care to enjoy a little BBQ over this ocean? Here the weather is perfect for this type of picnic."*
Miyuki, if you have Usagi-san...
*the voice on the radio again, marred by static: "Usagi-san? What is that, a type of wet noodle? Whatever it is, I got it riiiight over here..."*
Usagi-san!
*the cry of a crane comes over the radio: "Skreeeeeeee!"*
*Miyuki's voice on the radio again: "Know why this little crane was always around you? Gathering notes of your plans... I could inform the Morganas of your strategies, if I want..."*
My bookshelves...
*radio crackles again: "All life dies. And this one has no more use to me..."*
USAGI-SAN!
*a crane's screeches come over the radio: "Arck! Skree!... SKREEEEEEEE!!!"*
*Miyuki cackles on the radio again: "She won't really need this horn now, will she? Plopped right off like chopping a carrot! Hahahaha!"*
Kanchou! PLEASE DO SOMETHING!...

Fields.MenuText: Miyuki stop this at once! Stop hurting your sister!
Leave Usagi-san alone, you rusted shipwreck!
If you want someone to die, take me instead!

Fields.DialogueText: Please Miyuki-chan! Stop for me...
Miyuki, I swear, you let Usagi-san go right now!...
Kanchou?! This is not the time!
*Miyuki's crazed voice on the radio: "The head came right off. Can you believe it?"*
USA-GI-SAAAAAAAN!...
I will hunt you down till you're nothing but a pile of scrap, Miyuki!
*Miyuki's taunting voice on the radio: "Tut, tut. Is that how you speak to a lady? Morganas, teach them some manners..."*
Fubuki, stick with me... (switches off radio) Fubuki!
Usagi... Usagi is gone...
@BATTLE
Fubuki? Where did she go?... She couldn't have done anything drastic, right? Fubuki? Oh... the Farm!
There you are...
Hai...

Fields.MenuText: Hey...
Can I get you anything?
Are you going to be all right?

Fields.DialogueText: ...  Īe... Hai... I don't know...
I guess the epitome of despair is short bursts of Japanese. Does the snow feel nice under the cherry tree?
Fubuki, listen. What Miyuki did was wrong. Unforgivable. But now you have all the power in this situation, contrary to what you might think.
Arigatō. Hirune.
Hm, I guess you want me to leave you alone, but we don't have a choice. The waters are still thick.
Thick with Funayūrei. Hai, Kanchou. I crave nothing more than a fight right now.
@BATTLE
You have called upon me, Kanchou.
Fubuki, I am sorry to bother you now, but we really need help against these Morganas.
Kori no yona kaze.
Huh?
@BATTLE
Guess I should finally get these holes in my bookshelves repaired...
Her holes. Usagi's.
Hello, Fubuki. Would you like to help me restore these shelves?
Sure, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Thank you, Fubuki. I knew I could rely on you.
You are not thinking of knocking them over, are you?
Are you feeling any better, Fubuki?

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō, Kanchou, for the compliment.
Hm...
Not particularly, Kanchou, given the circumstances.
Hm, you know what? Let's knock these bookshelves over!
Huh? But why? Kanchou, you were trying to get these shelves back up and sturdy again.
Eh, it might be too boring to have them too perfect. What say you and me mess these shelves up and give it some character?
I would be delighted. Oof! (pushes over shelf after shelf)
Augh! That should be the last of them!...
Kanchou.
Hm?
Īe. Forget it. It is nothing, Kanchou.
Understood. I am coming to the bridge, Kanchou.
Maybe humor is necessary on the battlefield... but why can't I remember any of my little puns?
Fubuki... you're pacing again.
Find us some Funayūrei, Kanchou...
What a coincidence. Look off the port beam. Battle stations, Fubuki.
@BATTLE
Depressed still about Miyuki?
Meditating out here has helped some.

Fields.MenuText: A change of environment tends to bring out new ideas in the mind.
No seats out here...
Can I get you something more comfortable to sit on?

Fields.DialogueText: They do, hence why I am here, smelling all the food that resembles imagawayaki?
I do not need chairs. Sitting up against a bulkhead improves posture and heightens my thinking.
Īe. Propped up against the wall allows the perfect stance to think.
What are we supposed to do about Miyuki, Kanchou. I promised myself I would not hesitate to put her out of her misery, yet--
She is your sister, Fubuki.
Wakatteru. That is all the answer I need. Arigatō, Kanchou.
Huh? I was just completing your sentence...
You will not interrupt a joyous day, Funayūrei!
@BATTLE
Kanchou? May I get you to come with me for a brief moment?
Hm? Sure, I'm all yours now, Fubuki.
Heh... hai... Anyway, please come along. Close your eyes and hold my hand. Oh? Your hands are cold... Ah, here we are. Please open your eyes.
Whoa, what happened to the Farm? The temperature has risen.
But the sakura tree was allowed to bloom, Kanchou!

Fields.MenuText: Wait... why did you do this?
But what about the winter crops? The daikon, mitsuba...
How did you get the temperature to normalcy?

Fields.DialogueText: For you, Kanchou.
The winter crops have been moved to the galley. They were ready to be harvested. The seeds are stored in the box behind you over there.
I asked the crew to raise the temperature here for a short while. It allowed the sakura to bloom at its full potential.
Here, please come sit next to me.
I'd love to, Fubuki.
Ah... but the snow has all melted.
Oh... here.
What are you doing to my hair, Kanchou.
Hang on... There. Thought the hairpin would match the blossoms well.
Hmmpff... *sniffle*
Fubuki? Whoa... don't cry! What did I do wrong?
Nothing, Kanchou. Just... Arigatō. Arigatō, Kanchou.
You're welcome.
Kanchou, you will always be the bite in the winds.
Eh?
Kanchou. We must return to face Miyuki.
Again? She killed Usagi-san, Fubuki...
Hai, wakatteru. I have not forgotten, Kanchou, nor have I forgiven her yet... but I want to try and reach out to her.
And if she tries to harm anyone else, I'm taking her out.
*Some Time Later*
*radio crackles with an evil voice: "Welcome back to the show, losers. Want some fun today? No? Then let me send you straight to hell like I sent that damn bird!"*
Miyuki! You can't stop me from speaking to you, no matter what you say to me.
*radio crackles with static...*
Miyuki-chan. I am here.
*Miyuki's voice returns to the radio: "Are you sure about that? What about this! Have some fun... fun... Funayūrei!"*

Fields.MenuText: Fubuki... it's not working.
She heard you. You tried.
Fubuki, she's dangerous. Don't let your guard down.

Fields.DialogueText: Wakatteru! Miyuki-chan, please!
Miyuki-chan! Please remember your onee-san! Remember the photos!
Do you not think I assessed that possibility, Kanchou!?
Morgana contacts incoming.
Fubuki, but we need to concentrate on these new targets!
Very well, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
I know what you're thinking.
We are a team, Fubuki. I go with you.
Oh, Kanchou...
*radio screeches to life: "Oh, ya back now? HA! I'll send you to the grave! SKREE!"*
I'm still here, Fubuki.
Your hand... Arigatō, Kanchou.
Miyuki-chan! Listen to me! Just come back! How long will you keep up this facade?
*Miyuki's voice comes through the radio again: "NO facade. Just your DEATH."*
Remember. Remember everything we went through, sister!
What about Hokkaido!? We always wanted to see those white, glittering shores of snow. Did that mean nothing to you?
*Miyuki's voice comes through on the radio, softly: "I do what I MUST do. Get everyone away from MY property! Get that through your thick skull, sis.."*
Oh? Is that so? Hehe... Wakarimasu.

Fields.MenuText: Uh...
What did I just miss?
Are we going to destroy her now since she admits to violence?

Fields.DialogueText: Let us move back out, Kanchou. We have our own duties to attend to.
You were listening, Kanchou. It is all clear to us now.
Īe!
Let us leave her be now, Kanchou.
Miyuki! Kori no yona kaze! Never will they part!
*radio crackles softly: "Get outta here, ya fancy turd."*
Hehe, that is my Miyuki-chan.
Kanchou! How may I be of service to you and the ship?
Explain to me what happened back there between you and Miyuki. We had her right there... with no Morganas in sight. We could have struck her down.
Kanchou, in our recent conversations, have you not heard what Miyuki had to say? She had to get people away from *her* land. The only land she ever called "hers" was Hokkaido.
Our Hokkaido. We kept that place special in our hearts, and she wanted to fulfill her dying wish to protect the place we both wanted to see someday.
That is why she was sinking ships all this time.

Fields.MenuText: That doesn't make it right, Fubuki.
So it's okay that she takes innocent lives?
What about your old promise, Fubuki?

Fields.DialogueText: It does not, but it does provide beneficial services towards us.
Of course not, but we will divert ships away from Miyuki's area. For now, we will... use her in a way that does not harm her.
Life changes, like a course in the river, Kanchou. Our plans have now changed as such.
I don't follow, Fubuki.
We get the Funayūrei to waste their time and supplies fighting Miyuki, who can destroy anything that crosses her path. She will protect the area she loves.
So you want to use her as a distraction to buy us breathing room with the Morganas. Clever, Fubuki.
I will transmit a report to Command, asking them to signal all forces to avoid the Hokkaido region. We will let the Morganas waste their time on Miyuki.
My baby sister never lets up on her fire power... Oh... Funayūrei will have trouble with her...
@BATTLE
This pack off the starboard bow is all ours, though. Battle stations, Fubuki.
Yet another pack, Kanchou. Let us scatter these Funayūrei!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, can you come again with me?
Gladly, Fubuki. Do I close my eyes again?
Hai... and take my hand again. They have grown... warm. Please walk with me. Sit here. Not to close. Good. Please, open your eyes, Kanchou.
Wait, I've seen this before...
Hai. I have learned how to make imagawayaki myself, Kanchou. The crew is hard-working, and they deserve every ration of it.

Fields.MenuText: Where did you get the pan?
Where did you get that mini burner?
Still pinching ingredients from the galley?

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Purchased with my own funds, Kanchou, I assure you.
The cooks offered me this as a "late" birthday present.
Ha! I asked permission from the galley. The cooks agreed, in light of our recent successes.
I imagine you want the custard ones, Kanchou.
If you please, Fubuki. Ah, thank you. Delicious!
Mhm. When no one was looking, Usagi-san would devour the custard ones behind my back. What a mischievous little bird she was.
Fubuki...
Please do not worry, Kanchou. I know she is at peace now.
Your strength is impressive, Fubuki.
Kanchou, you compliment me too much. *blush*
Embrace the icy winds, Funayūrei!
@BATTLE
Ah, Kanchou, there you are. I really must speak with you.
Hm?
Hai. Take this hair pin.
Wait, but this was Miyuki's.
Īe. It is mine to give now.
Fubuki? Your hand...
Kanchou. I do not know how long I get to be with you.
But, if I am to live the life I have now, I want to with every second I have left with you.
I took for granted all the time I had with Miyuki-chan... and even Usagi-san. Their memories should never be forgotten so... I want you to remember them, too. Please... take it.

Fields.MenuText: I'll keep you close.
I will keep this with me always.
Thank you, Fubuki.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou...
Well said, Kanchou.
Heh, you are most welcome, Captain.
Don't let go of my hands yet.
I won't, Fubuki. I want to ask something though. Before you left Miyuki, what were you saying to her? I never did ask you about that.
Miyuki's name means "beautiful snow" and my name means "blizzard". Together, we formed a bond we named kori no yona kaze.
Without her, there would be no beautiful snow to scatter across the world. And she cannot live without me, for I carry her beautiful snow within my arms.
That's beautiful.
Arigatō! *kiss*
